author: markv
title: Healthcare & Wellness Marketplace
description: Healthcare products & services are expensive because its not decentralised from big businesses making it inaccessible to lower income groups

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal would be within the challenge goal,  and I think that this proposal probably will increase utility & adoption of Cardano Smart. At the same time the statement of how problem is to be solved is only high-level explained and in my opinion it doesn’t clear how the Healthcare & Wellness market will adopt these features, and it doesn’t clear how this proposal can create incentive for healthcare vendors and customers.
I think it's important to improve details about the proposal services solution for the challenge (eg. Typical services use case for heathcare vendors, example benefit for service consumers and for Cardano community, …).
f6_assessments.q1:
There are only one link in the proposal that refers to the project manager, but it is diffcult to immagine the 2 people teams that work on the proposal and the proposal assessment is difficult.
The scope of the solution is explained (e.g. how the funds will be spent, what features will be implemented, and so on…). There is a too simple cost worksheet, that doesn’t contain all costs (eg. Infrastructure, cloud license, etc.)
The plan for implementation is very simple and must have been a bit more specific to be assessted.
f6_assessments.q2:
The given metrics measure what the proposer wants to do. As mentioned above, the description of the solution is poorly explained (e.g. how the funds will be spent, how the solution improve their customer experience, and so on…), so the progress of this proposal is not simple to assess.
The proposer belong from an un-successful Fund7 proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal has discussed the relationship between personal data and services in businesses, which is the area for the team to exploit by using blockchain and tokens to offer a sound solution for healthcare cost reduction. They also make it clear about their goal to raise people’s knowledge about their health for better management. The proposal has successfully mentioned the main feature of the Marketplace using B2C tools to connect consumers and businesses helping companies and corporations offer better products and services, which are aligned with the key metrics of the challenge setting. They have effectively determined their target audience, aims, and impacts of their solution.
The potential risk is foreseen but no solution is offered to mitigate. The proposers need to come up with the addressing plan to show the community their proactivity in risk management, therefore their credibility.
f6_assessments.q1:
Their man activities in the implementation process are listed, however, they are still vague since there is no specific time for each step. In this section, they can offer a more detailed timeline including the estimated finishing time, and even the person or department will responsible for the task. By this detailed schedule, the community will be able to track and examine whether the team keeps pace with the rate of progress or not.
The major costs in the duration of the project are listed, however, this can be slightly unclear for the community to get the soundness of their spending. They can be more specific. For example, in the blockchain work, they can provide the estimated amount of money for each section deployed. The team members are well described with relevant experience and capacity to properly run the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The briefly mentioned their approaches to measure the progress and development of the project. The community members will have a chance to trial the app's functionality, which gives an authentic experience and therefore, offer the fairest assessment. However, particular KPIs or metrics together with the required numbers will be preferable since they will help the community better visualize and examine their success

f6_assessments.q0: An innovative idea that would undoubtedly benefit both providers and customers. Consumers will have a great marketplace where they can ensure the quality of items, and suppliers will have another route to locate more customers both locally and worldwide. I think that by combining consumer data with innovative technology, the healthcare business can enter a new age of growth and development. Previously, the inability to securely communicate and access sensitive patient data has had a significant impact on the medical sector. Blockchain, on the other hand, would enable highly configurable openness while preserving only the highest security requirements to ensure real interoperability.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal included an overview of the key members' experience in the healthcare and tech field as well as their LinkedIn profiles. I think the team has the requisite expertise and knowledge to properly implement this plan. 

However, the strategy and timeframe should be more specific, separated into parts, and indicate the number of individuals that will be participating in the testing stage.
f6_assessments.q2: A timeline of how the proposal will be executed is missing. There might be people not using discord, so expanding the announce to other channel should be considered. Besides, more specific metrics could help the community track the progress easier.

f6_assessments.q0: This,proposal aims  solve the problem of expensive healthcare products and services for lower income groups by developing a Marketplace where providers have to develop cheaper and accessible service delivery models through competitions. In short, yes, I agree that this project can have an impact that everyone can have equal chances of providing and accessing healthcare and services. However, it seems to me that the description is quite general since there is no clear impact on the ecosystem. It could have been mentioned how many people are targeted and should join the community, how many providers are expected to be in the market, etc. I suggest that some deliverables should be clearly provided. One more extra suggestion is that some communication plan to attract both the consumer side and business side should be added.
f6_assessments.q1: The team members are quite committed and there are links to verify their capabilities, except for Mark Valmoria’s profile link. Although the author has mentioned their upcoming plan, I think that it should have a time frame schedule telling how the team will achieve the goals listed at the end of the proposal. More detailed information should be provided in the budget breakdown. For instance, what tasks including in the blockchain work that need 30K? or what “feature” in the “building the seller management functionalities and features”? What marketing method should be used since different ways of advertising can cost different sums of money. Besides, it would be good if the team can give an estimated number of how many healthcare professors will be onboarded? Providing more information on this can help to understand the rationale behind the number and check its fairness/ plausibility.
f6_assessments.q2: Unfortunately, this proposal lacks information regarding its audibility. The only information that would enable it to be kept track is that progress will be reported to subscribers through announcements on a discord server. The team should have added a roadmap, even if it’s short and includes only a small number of steps. Besides, some KPIs regarding the development of the project after it’s developed and running also should be included; so that the community can keep track of both the proposal and its success after being developed.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer claimed that the project is a solution to the spiraling costs of healthcare. The team is seeking funds to develop a marketplace using Blockchain Decentralized ID(DID's) and Stable tokens implementation to secure the provider’s data and make services accessible and available globally. The goal of the proposal is quite clear, to reduce prices for services and the providers will offer more value added services, decrease the gap between rich and poor, company size and geography. If this proposal is to be implemented successfully, it means civilizers from developing countries can get access to advanced businesses' healthcare services globally, as well as small organizations can offer their services directly to consumers globally at an equal footing with big brands. The idea is ambitious and worth-praising. The intention is clear and sensible. The team also foresees some possible challenges, which is appropriate but unfortunately no sensible solution is presented to show how they plan to tackle them. It would be nice if the proposer provides a plan on how to react with “barriers to entry in some jurisdictions”. Despite that, I strongly believe the proposal is well-written and it does address the challenge very well.
f6_assessments.q1: Two people, already committed, with healthcare experience and blockchain understanding have managed to combine a very diversified mix of talents and experience across a wide variety of fields. Referrals on LinkedIn were provided, so experience can be validated from that standpoint. However, I would suggest that the first background include some reliable links illustrating the initial works to increase the project's feasibility. The proposal also mentions recruiting new members from the Cardano community. My recommendation is that the team provide further information on how many individuals are required, the abilities required for each specific role, and what duties are required to contribute to the implementation. The plan does not provide enough information; it appears subjective and does not provide clarity on what will be created in the coming weeks or months. Unfortunately, due to a lack of information about the time, milestones and steps to take in order to attain the stated objective appear unreasonable and imprecise to what is being proposed. The budget is divided into three major categories: blockchain work, seller management functionalities, marketing, and onboarding. But, once again, none of them are clear, making it difficult to carry out the feasibility assessment and ensure the fairness of the budget breakdown. The team could consider defining and explaining particular expenses that should be broken down into identifiable items, as "30K for blockchain work (Tokens, DID's, Wallets, Payments, Governance Modules)" is insufficient to understand. Based on all this information, I don’t believe that this proposal is highly feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: The author of this claim that people can keep track of what the project is heading through a discord server. I wonder if it’s accessible for everyone or just auditors? It would be greatly beneficial if these information were included: how long does the trial last for early participants? How many participants have the chance to be onboarded (no need an exact number but at least an estimation)? And how is “early” in this situation? With answers to those questions, I would have a clearer vision of the project. The measurement of success is not sufficient to audit, also the success definition seems to be a bit short and hard to understand. All in all, this proposal needs to indicate more information to assist in tracing the auditability and grow trust in voters.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is vaguely written, it does not describe a precise solution to their problem statement, it goes on to outline a generalised, hyped answer that has no concrete steps involved. The proposers mention they want to build a marketplace that “will develop B2C tools for the consumer side and business side to collaborate with each other to create compelling products and services that are personalised to the consumer based on their aggregated data insights.”
When following up on the website link they have provided, the solution they offer is actually clearly described on the front page: “We are a gamified personal data aggregation and storage service. What that means, is that we will collect your data for you so that you can create your own personal database.”
They motivate that having access to their data, the consumers will be able to access healthcare services around the globe without restriction, “Because the consumers have their data this will mean that they can access non-regulated services offered wherever they may be in the world”, but how and what services will be available is not clearly described.
Due to a lack of information it’s hard to assess the impact of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
The detailed plan offers some insight into the steps needed to implement their proposal, but there is no timeline dedicated to create a better sense of the process progression and the time needed to have it executed.
The budget is only superficially described, there is a category requesting $20k named “building the seller management fucntionalities and features” that is not presented what it would entail and how many people and hours would be necessary for it.
The team members have an almost complete description, the main developer does not have any third-party links to his previous work and there is also mentioned that “We will be recruiting more people help us with our build from the Cardano community if successful with the funding using financial and non-fianancial incentives to early team members.” but no further details on how many people and what skills they would need to possess.
f6_assessments.q2:
The progress description is relatively accurate, reports on their discord server, community participants that can onboard their app testing early, number of early partnerships and suppliers are all sufficient for development tracking - though how can those partnerships be independently verified?
The success description has no clear milestones that could help identify any measure of success: “a working prototype ready for deployment for product-market fit testing” is just a general statement, having numbers attached to it would greatly improve in the assessing - how many people testing it is considered a success, in what time having the test app ready is also considered a success etc.

f6_assessments.q0:
"The project aims to publicize service information and market prices in the medical field in order to promote information transparency and help consumers get the best service prices.
As a possible idea, especially in the medical field, this has profound humanistic meanings. This was also recently implemented by the government of my country. Hope you get funding to deploy."
f6_assessments.q1: The team has a clear agenda, with over 20 years of experience in their medical field. They also have personnel who have attended plutus and haskell courses that show the seriousness of the members involved in the project. In addition, the idea is practical and also an inevitable need to make medical services transparent, helping patients get the best service prices. You can present more details about the plan and completion date, as well as standardize the information system to make it accessible to users.
f6_assessments.q2: This is a continuation of the idea from fund 7, they plan to clearly report the progress of the work, and leave it open for the community to follow. This shows that the working team is willing to publicize the work information so that the community can easily check the results. You should systematize this information on an official website with enough pictures and videos of activities like many projects have done. This makes the team work close to the community and easy to receive support.

solution: Empower consumers with data and choice to force providers to develop cheaper and accessible service delivery models through more competition
experience: Over 20 years as Healthcare Professional. Built Small Businesses. Atala Prism and Plutus Pioneer Program Cohort. https://www.linkedin.com/in/mark-valmoria-45a021228/
